text: Allan Burns (May 18, 1935January 30, 2021) was an American screenwriter and television producer. He was best known for creating and writing for the television sitcom The Munsters, The Mary Tyler Moore Show and Rhoda. He won three Primetime Emmy Awards in 1968, 1971 and 1977 for comedic writing. Burns died on January 30, 2021, at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:Screenwriters from Maryland Category:Writers from Baltimore
title: Allan Burns
